title: August 14
description:
Good bye, France! What a year it's been.

This year wasn't only about Paris. It's been fabulous to see so much of Europe: London, Wales, Berlin, Malta, Venice, Tuscany, Rome, Dublin, the French Alps, the Cotswolds and Jurassic Coast of England, Vienna, the Loire Valley, Normandy, Scotland, Provence and the island of Porquerolles.

Also, it's been great to see all our European friends such as Katja, Connie, Barbara, Hazel & Tim, Susan & John, Fanak, Tony, Frédéric, Thomas, Harold, Lou, Alexandra & Hartmut, Léo and countless family members. Plus, of course, we made several new friends.

children.title: Dress Up
children.description:
Iris and Zoé stayed over at our house for our last few days in France. The four cousins made it their mission to play with every resource available one last time.

The costume box saw a lot of action.

children.title: Monopoly
children.description:
The kids managed to suck Lucie into a 5 hour game of Monopoly. Although she enjoyed it (and won) she declined the offer to do a rematch the next day... someone had to take care of the packing!

Stuffed animals were enrolled to play in her place.

children.title: Sand Art
children.description: Remember all those colorful sands we collected in the Colorado de Lustrel? We actually did something with it.

children.title: Spoon
children.description: Iris carefully spoons layers of differently-colored sand to create a beautiful mini landscape in a jar.

children.title: Sieve
children.description: Babushka removes impurity and breaks apart lumps using a thin sieve.

children.title: Inspection
children.description: Zoé ponders her jar... does this need a little red sand now, or a little more yellow one?

children.title: Mementos
children.description:
Ah, the memories!

There was a postcard rack in Lucie's office. As the year unfolded, it collected all sort of brochures, tickets and other little mementos of all our activities and trips. It's been a very full year.

children.title: Tent
children.description:
After two days of the kids playing in every room with every toy, game and anything in sight, the house was a giant mess. Here is a yurt they build with chairs and blankets.

Thankfully, at one point they miraculously decided on their own that enough was enough. They went into cleaning mode and tidied up every mess they had made and then some. They even swept the floors.

children.title: Elle Me Dit
children.description: Morning ritual: every day we listened to our favorite single of the moment on YouTube ("Elle Me Dit" by Mika) and danced all our might.

children.title: Mika
children.description:
Once we had learned the lyrics by heart thanks to the video, we took our dancing downstairs. Mika is Felix and Milo's favorite singer. We danced to all his best hits.

The girls approved. We made them a CD.

children.title: Plane
children.description:
The fateful day finally arrived. On August 11, 2011, we headed back home. We had left California exactly a year before, on August 10, 2010.

The flight was uneventful. The kids watched movies. Milo slept for the entire second portion of our trip (from Washington to San Francisco).

children.title: Home
children.description:
Home, sweet home.

We are very happy to be reunited. We are busy putting our house on Grant Street back in order.
